plugins.name: TextSwapper
plugins.description:
Features


Easily customize text for legal contracts, sales proposals, and resumes in Figma.

Quickly update text without needing extra tools.

Streamlined text replacement for multiple objects, components, and frames.

Simple and intuitive interface for seamless integration with your workflow.

Save time ‚è∞ and eliminate the hassle of manually editing text in Figma!

How:


Add the word "page" to the name of your page frame (e.g., agreement_page).

Enter the text you want to replace in the "Find text" field (e.g., {company name}).

Enter the new text in the "Replace with" field (e.g., Figma).

Use the "Update" button to replace the specified line, or the "Update All" button to replace all occurrences of the text in your document.

Use the + and - buttons to adjust the number of text fields.

Click Save to store your list of text replacements for faster updates when working on the same document.

Use Load to retrieve your saved list of text replacements and automatically fill in the fields. The current version retrieves only the latest saved list.

Click Download Selected Pages as PDF to download the selected pages as one merged PDF file.
plugins.tagline: Easily customize text for legal contracts, sales proposals, and resumes‚Äîno extra tools needed.

plugins.name: batchy
plugins.description:
batchy is a helper tool to make your exports more comfortable. Instead of just using the layer name and getting the layer size, you will now be able to write your own asset name dynamically with the help of export tokens and choosing between layer size or screen size for your assets.


Features

  1. dynamic asset names with several export tokens like: layers, date, file, scaling, index, user, top-level frame name,
  2. export assets in layer or screen size (top-level frame)
  3. export your current selection
  4. export from an asset list
  5. date formats for your naming
  6. export in common file formats like png, jpg, svg, pdf
  7. multiple files will be downloaded as a zip, single files will be downloaded as single files
  8. OS-proofed asset name support
plugins.tagline: Export your designs with dynamic name behaviors.

plugins.name: Node Exporter
plugins.description:
üß© Node Exporter


Node Exporter is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you extract full or partial JSON data from selected design nodes ‚Äî including all their children ‚Äî with just a click.


‚ú® Features


- üîç Inspect any selected nodes in your Figma file

- üßæ Export all node properties (deep scan via prototype chain)

- ‚úÖ Or choose specific common properties to extract (e.g., name, width, layoutMode)

- üå≥ Recursively includes children of selected nodes

- üíæ Outputs clean, downloadable `.json` files

- ‚ö°Ô∏è Fast, no setup, no code required


---


üöÄ How to Use


1. Install the plugin from Figma Community

2. Open your Figma or FigJam file

3. Select one or more nodes

4. Right-click ‚Üí Plugins ‚Üí Node Exporter

5. You'll see two options:

- `‚ú® Export All Properties`: grabs every readable property for all selected nodes and children

- `üîß Choose Properties to Export`: shows a checkbox list of common properties you can include

6. Click the relevant button and a `.json` file will automatically download!


---


üì¶ Example Use Cases


- Design-to-code workflows

- Creating component libraries

- Auditing design system properties

- JSON handoff for frontend developers

- Custom design analysis


---


üîê Permissions


Node Exporter does not require any network access or authentication. All processing is done locally in your editor.


---


üß† Tech Notes


- Uses JavaScript reflection to walk the prototype chain

- Safe error handling (non-serializable properties skipped)

- Deep export support for nested `children` arrays


---


üë®‚Äçüíª Developer Info


Created by Agent Null

Have ideas, feedback or bugs? Open an issue or contribute!
plugins.tagline: Extract all or selected node properties as JSON, including children ‚Äî quick, clean, and magical!

plugins.name: SVG Exporter
plugins.description:
Este plugin te permite exportar elementos gr√°ficos (assets) en formato SVG desde cualquier Frame que selecciones en Figma. Al ejecutarlo:

1. El plugin detecta autom√°ticamente los vectores, √≠conos y componentes dentro del frame seleccionado.

2. Muestra una lista con vista previa de cada asset, su nombre y tipo (VECTOR, LINE, COMPONENT, etc.).

3. Puedes filtrar por tipo, seleccionar o deseleccionar assets individualmente o todos a la vez.

4. Al hacer clic en ‚ÄúExportar selecci√≥n‚Äù, los archivos se descargan en un ZIP listo para usar.


Uso paso a paso:

‚Ä¢ Selecciona un Frame que contenga los assets que deseas exportar.

‚Ä¢ Ejecuta el plugin.

‚Ä¢ Filtra, selecciona y exporta.


Limitaciones actuales:

‚Ä¢ Solo funciona si seleccionas un Frame (no soporta m√∫ltiples frames a la vez).

‚Ä¢ Solo exporta elementos compatibles con formato SVG.

‚Ä¢ No incluye im√°genes rasterizadas, texto plano ni auto layout como exportables.

‚Ä¢ No detecta autom√°ticamente cambios de selecci√≥n; requiere usar el bot√≥n ‚ÄúActualizar selecci√≥n‚Äù.



-----------------------------------------


This plugin lets you export graphical elements (assets) as SVG files from any selected Frame in Figma.


When you run the plugin:

1. It scans the selected frame for valid exportable elements (e.g., VECTORS, ICONS, COMPONENTS).

2. You‚Äôll see a list of assets with preview thumbnails, names, and their Figma types.

3. You can filter by type, toggle selection, and bulk-select assets.

4. Clicking ‚ÄúExport Selection‚Äù downloads all selected assets as a clean ZIP file of SVGs.


How to use it:

‚Ä¢ Select a Frame that contains the assets you want to export.

‚Ä¢ Launch the plugin.

‚Ä¢ Use the filters, select assets, and export.


Current limitations:

‚Ä¢ Only one Frame can be selected at a time.

‚Ä¢ Only elements that support SVG export will be included (e.g., no bitmaps or text layers).

‚Ä¢ Does not automatically react to new selections ‚Äî use the ‚ÄúRefresh Selection‚Äù button manually when needed.
plugins.tagline: Exporta f√°cilmente assets SVG desde frames seleccionados en Figma, con vista previa y filtros.

plugins.name: Text Auto Fill
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin User Guide for Beginners


What It Does

This Figma plugin lets you update text and hide layers in selected frames or instances. It‚Äôs easy to use with a text-based configuration for both specific and global changes.


How to Use It

  1. Select a Frame or Instance: In Figma, click a frame or instance to edit.
  2. Open the Plugin: Run the plugin from Figma‚Äôs menu (Plugins > Your Plugin Name).
  3. Enter Configuration: In the plugin window, type instructions to change text or hide layers (see examples below).
  4. Click Run: The plugin applies your changes instantly.


Configuration Examples

‚Ä¢ Change Specific Text: To update text in a layer named title inside a frame named block, type:

block.title: Hello World

This sets the title layer‚Äôs text to "Hello World".


‚Ä¢ Change Text Globally: To update all layers named text in any frame, type:

text: Welcome

This changes every text layer‚Äôs text to "Welcome".


‚Ä¢ Hide a Specific Layer: To hide a layer named subtitle in the block frame, type:

//block.subtitle

This hides the subtitle layer.


‚Ä¢ Hide a Layer Globally: To hide all layers named icon, type:

//icon

This hides every icon layer.


‚Ä¢ Rename a Frame: To rename a frame named block, type:

$Title block: New Frame Name

This renames the frame to "New Frame Name".


‚Ä¢ Combine Actions: Mix specific and global changes, like:

block.title: Welcome
text: Hello
//block.subtitle
//icon

This updates block.title to "Welcome", all text layers to "Hello", hides block.subtitle, and hides all icon layers.


Tips

  1. Write one instruction per line.
  2. Layer names must match exactly (case-sensitive).
  3. Select at least one frame or instance, or you‚Äôll get an error.
plugins.tagline: Automatically update text in frames with key-value data

plugins.name: Fieldnotes
plugins.description:
Fieldnotes transforms in-person workshop sticky notes into digital boards.


Simply take photos of your sticky notes using your phone (you just have to scan a QR code to sync) or upload images directly to the plugin. Your physical sticky notes are instantly recreated in your board, preserving the texts, colors, position, and all your ideas :)


Fieldnotes combines several AI recognition technologies to boost accuracy and to detect even messy handwriting across multiple languages.

Pro users gain access to powerful AI-enhanced features including text improvement, grammar correction, and automatic workshop summaries.


Transform raw workshop notes into polished, actionable content and generate comprehensive takeaways to share with stakeholders, a dream follow-up!


If you want to learn more about the plugin or simply because you are passionate about Product or collaboration, feel free to reach out
plugins.tagline: Fieldnotes transforms pictures of sticky notes into stickies ‚Äî ready to share, without the hassle

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click ‚ÄúEnable Arabic Mode‚Äù or ‚ÄúDisable Arabic Mode‚Äù
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  1. Only components that already have an "arabic" variable will be updated
  2. The plugin does not create new properties ‚Äî please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

plugins.name: Quick styles
plugins.description:
How does the plugin works:


Save a Style

1.Open the plugin library.

2.Select the layer you want to save styles from.

3.Click Save on one of the style slots in the plugin.

4.The style is saved!


Set a Shortcut

1.Open System Settings.

2.Navigate to Keyboard > Keyboard Shortcuts > App Shortcuts.

3.Click on the plus (+) icon.

4.Set the app to Figma in the menu.

5.Type the exact menu title name.

6.Set your shortcut and click Done!


Apply a Style

1.Select any layer.

2.Use the menu item or shortcut to apply styles!
plugins.tagline: Save properties of a layer and quickly apply them from the menu or using a shortcut.

plugins.name: 10x HTML | Design to clean responsive code 10x faster
plugins.description:
‚ö°Ô∏è Instantly turn your Figma design into clean, responsive HTML / CSS / SCSS

üöÄ No registration, no paywall, click and get your code

üîç Preview / inspect the generated code in Figma

‚ö°Ô∏è Test responsiveness and make live adjustments

üéì Smart layout and naming



Who is it for ?


  1. Beginner looking to turn a design into a website starting from a clean structure where 90% of the work is already handled


  1. Advanced front-end developers looking to drastically speed up their workflow without compromising on the structure and readability of their code.


No registration required - run the plugin, select a frame and preview the result in a single click.

Works in design mode only (for now, but let us know if you're interested for dev mode)



What is 10x HTML ?


Most design-to-code tools generate bloated or messy output, with non optimized layout.

That‚Äôs because extracting logic from a visual design ‚Äî especially an unstructured one ‚Äî is a hard problem..


10x HTML was built from the ground up with the clear goal of solving those issues with smart rules and layout inference.


We focus on :

- Understanding layout intent

- Reducing unnecessary nesting

- Recognizing repeated patterns (even copy-pasted ones)

- Grouping elements intelligently

- and more...


10x HTML doesn't claim to replace a frontend developer ‚Äî but it dramatically accelerates your workflow by giving you clean, factorized and structured code that you can build on.


Whether you're a beginner or an experienced front-end developer, 10xHTML is designed to handle most of the heavy lifting for you‚Äîmaking smart assumptions when needed and delivering perfect code with clear naming and structure that‚Äôs easy to build upon.


Clean, semantic code ‚Äì without the mess

- Converts buttons, inputs, headers, and more into proper HTML elements

- Uses a smart class system: base classes, modifiers, and utilities based on context

- Picks optimized class names

- Flattens overly nested layers


Smart, responsive export

- Fully responsive by default ‚Äî includes media and container queries

- Detects and links similar elements, even without components

- Intelligently groups and infers layout, even from unstructured designs


Live code and layout inspection

- Preview the final webpage right in Figma

- Test responsiveness

- Do live update to adjust the code

- Download the code and get ready for production


How to reach out ?

üí¨ Request support here

üí° Suggest an improvement here

üï∑ Report a bug here

üöÄ Join our Discord for support, feedback or questions..


‚ö†Ô∏è Note :

10x HTML is currently free and fully accessible as a Beta version.

We are trying to gather as much feedback as possible, so please feel free to post any kind of comments (bug report, idea, opinion...)

Once we reach the level of maturity we‚Äôre aiming for, we will switch to a paid model

(with very reasonable pricing)
plugins.tagline: Convert your design to high quality HTML / CSS / SCSS in one click and download your code.

plugins.name: Frame Navigator
plugins.description:
üß≠ FrameNavigator


Effortlessly navigate large and complex Figma files with FrameNavigator ‚Äî a floating Table of Contents plugin that helps you stay organized and move between frames in a single click.


‚ú® Key Features


- Quick Navigation

Instantly jump to any frame from a floating panel that stays visible while you work.


- Custom Frame Registration

Select frames directly on the canvas and add them to your TOC with a simple "+" button.


- Group Organization

Organize your frames into custom groups for better structure and clarity‚Äîperfect for managing multiple screens.


- Flexible Panel Sizes

Choose between default, compact, and full views to match your workflow and screen space.


---


üõ† How It Works


  1. Register a Frame: Select a frame on the Figma canvas and click the `+` button in the plugin to add it to the TOC.
  2. Create a Group: Hover over ungrouped frames in the TOC and click the appearing checkbox to select them. Then click the Create Group button at the top of the panel to group them.
  3. Add to Existing Group: Select a group first, then select a new frame on the canvas and click `+` to add the frame into that group.
  4. Rename a Group: Double-click on a group name to edit it.
  5. Remove a Group: Right-click on a group and select **Remove Group**. ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: All frames inside that group will also be removed from the TOC.
  6. Reorder Frames: Drag and drop frames (or groups) within the TOC to change their order.


---


Perfect for design system creators, large prototyping flows, or anyone managing multi-screen layouts in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Quickly jump between frames with a floating table of contents. Easily build your own TOC.

124359.description:
DraftAlpha ‚Äì Figma Plugin

Deliver consistent UX content aligned with your brand guidelines


DraftAlpha enables you to effortlessly create, collaborate, and maintain brand-consistent UX content directly within Figma.


Key Features:


‚úÖ AI-powered Brand Guidelines Builder

- Instantly generate tailored brand guidelines, including writing rules, tone of voice, target audience, and brand pillars.

- Customize guidelines precisely to reflect your brand identity.


‚úÖ Content Consistency & Compliance

- Automatically check content for adherence to your established brand guidelines.

- Generate multiple content variants aligned with your brand.


‚úÖ Centralized Content & Collaboration

- Single source of truth for all UX copy and team collaboration.

- Approval workflows, user roles, and content status management.

- Build reusable content components with localization support.


‚úÖ Seamless Localization

- Quickly generate brand-consistent localized content in 20+ languages.

- Manage and apply localization variants directly in Figma.


‚úÖ Integrated Figma Workflow

- Access your content library and apply content to designs instantly.

- Real-time brand guideline compliance checking within your design files.

- Effortlessly preview designs across multiple language variants.
124359.tagline: Deliver UX Content consistent with brand guidelines
